mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Clarysville Hospital. Civil War Records of Samuel West, Physician
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Patient Record for Cox, Richard A.
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Monongahalia Co. VA [Monongalia County, West Virginia]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Cox, Richard A. Patient Age: 29. Marital Status: Married. Diagnosis: Gun shot fracture of the neck and head and of the left humerus. Ball entering two inches below coracoid process direction inwards and backwards and probably lodged behind the scapula. Excision on 1864/08/04 letter S. Location Wounded: In act[ion] at Winchester, Va. Date Wounded: 1864/07/20. Nature of Wound: Bullet. Result: Discharged from service.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Cox, Richard A.

Gun shot fracture of the neck and head and of the left humerus. Ball entering two inches below coracoid process direction inwards and backwards and probably lodged behind the scapula. Excision on 1864/08/04 letter S
Private
E
14th VA Vols [14th West Virginia Volunteer Infantry]
